product.description: All wood with canvas sails. Measures 31 1/2 inches in Length, 22 inches High and 4 3/4 inches Wide. Many extras.\r\nThe schooner Bluenose was built in Nova Scotia in 1921 to fish the rough waters off the coast of Newfoundland. Because of the Bluenose racing prowess she became the pride of all Canadians. Still featured on stamps and the Canadian dime, the Bluenose was lost off Haiti in 1946.
